title: Natural Indigo Shibori Dye Kit
description: Discover the magic of natural indigo. This kit contains everything needed to dye fabric using the traditional Japanese Shibori tie-dye technique.
story: Sourced from a small family farm in South India, our indigo is naturally and ethically grown.

title: Beginner's Moss Green Wall Tapestry Kit
description: Learn the basics of tapestry weaving with a beautifully designed kit. Includes a small wooden loom and natural, moss-green yarn to create a wall hanging.
story: The loom frame is handcrafted from reclaimed wood in Oregon, minimizing waste and supporting local craftspeople.

title: Hand-Built Terracotta Planter Kit
description: An introduction to hand-building pottery techniques (pinch and coil). Includes air-dry terracotta clay and tools to create a set of two small planters.
story: The clay is harvested and processed with minimal impact, and all packaging is made from recycled materials.

title: Herbal Tea Garden Starter Kit
description: Start your own mini medicinal and culinary tea garden right on your windowsill. Includes seeds for chamomile, mint, and lemon balm, plus biodegradable pots.
story: We partner with an organic seed bank that commits to preserving heirloom and rare seed varieties.

title: Traditional Pine Needle Coiled Basketry
description: Master the ancient art of coiled basketry. This kit uses naturally dried pine needles and hemp twine to create a decorative, fragrant basket.
story: All pine needles are ethically wild-foraged, ensuring sustainable harvesting practices protect the forest floor.

title: Earth Pigment Watercolor Kit
description: Create your own vibrant watercolors from natural, mineral-based pigments. Includes four earth pigments, binder, and mixing palette.
story: The pigments are collected from naturally occurring ochres and clays and processed using traditional, non-toxic methods.

title: Recycled Paper Making Kit
description: Turn old scraps of paper into beautiful, textured sheets infused with flowers or seeds. Perfect for sustainable stationery or craft projects.
story: Kit includes a high-quality, reusable wooden mold and deckle handcrafted by a small, family-run woodworking shop.

title: Zero-Waste Beeswax Food Wrap Kit
description: A practical kit to make your own reusable food wraps, eliminating plastic waste. Includes organic cotton fabric, beeswax, and simple instructions.
story: The beeswax comes from a sustainable apiary that prioritizes bee health over commercial honey production.

title: Beginner Macrame Plant Hanger
description: Learn the essential knots and create a chic, minimalist plant hanger for indoor use. Includes recycled cotton cord and a metal ring.
story: The cotton cord is made from pre-consumer textile waste, diverted from landfills and spun into new fiber.

title: Cold-Process Natural Soap Making Kit
description: Make 6 bars of moisturizing soap with natural ingredients. Includes high-quality organic oils, essential oils, and safety equipment for cold-process soap.
story: Features organic oils and sustainably harvested lye, providing a truly natural and skin-friendly finished product.

title: Beginner Spoons Wood Carving Kit
description: A safe introduction to 'whittling' to create your own wooden spoon. Includes a pre-cut block of sustainably sourced wood and a safety-focused carving knife.
story: Wood sourced from responsibly managed forests where sustainable yield is prioritized over clear-cutting.

title: Eco-Printing Leaf Dye Kit on Silk
description: Transfer the natural pigments of collected leaves and flowers onto a luxurious silk scarf using the gentle, eco-friendly steaming method.
story: The kit encourages local foraging and includes a guide to identifying non-toxic and abundant local dye sources.

title: Gourmet Mushroom Growing Kit (Oyster)
description: Grow your own delicious and organic Oyster mushrooms in a matter of weeks. Simple indoor kit requiring only water and indirect light.
story: Substrate is made from recycled coffee grounds and sawdust, promoting a circular economy and reducing waste.

title: Minimalist Botanical Embroidery Hoop
description: A relaxing project featuring delicate lines and nature-inspired motifs. Includes linen fabric, an embroidery hoop, and plant-dyed thread.
story: The embroidery floss is dyed using plant-based materials like onion skins and avocado pits, eliminating synthetic chemicals.

title: Recycled Glass Bead Bracelet Making
description: Create two unique, stackable bracelets using beautiful beads crafted from recycled glass. Includes all materials and a jewelry repair tool.
story: Beads are made using traditional methods by Ghanaian artisans, providing fair wages and preserving cultural craft.

title: Advanced Coiled Pottery Kit
description: Focus on refining your hand-building skills to create a larger, structured coiled pot. Includes professional-grade clay and advanced shaping tools.
story: This kit features specialized tools made from sustainably harvested bamboo, minimizing the environmental footprint.

title: Soy Wax Candle Making Kit (Cedar & Sage)
description: Pour two all-natural candles using 100% US-grown soy wax and pure essential oils for a calming cedar and sage scent. Includes glass jars and wicks.
story: The soy wax is sourced from non-GMO, American-grown soybeans, supporting domestic farmers and sustainable agriculture.

title: Traditional Hand-Woven Bamboo Fan
description: Learn basic basketry techniques by weaving a beautiful, lightweight hand-held fan using natural, split bamboo strips.
story: Bamboo is one of the world's most sustainable materials, rapidly renewable and requiring minimal water or pesticides to grow.

title: Modern Faux Kintsugi Repair Kit
description: Embrace the Japanese art of Kintsugi (golden repair) to mend broken ceramics with gold-colored epoxy, making the flaw a feature.
story: This kit celebrates the beauty of imperfection and encourages mindful consumption by extending the life of beloved objects.

title: Needle Felting: Woodland Critter Starter
description: Create a charming, small 3D felted animal using simple needle felting techniques. Includes wool roving, felting needles, and finger guards.
story: The wool is sourced from a local farm that practices ethical sheep shearing and animal husbandry.
